main event: On March 21, 1957, a UFO was observed falling to the Earth in Springfield, Missouri and Joplin, Missouri. The object appeared to have exploded and then disappeared in 2 to 3 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a grapefruit, initially white and then turning light green.
No vapor trail or explosion was observed, contradicting the notion that the object exploded.
The observation lasted only 2-3 seconds, indicating a brief but significant event.
The weather and winds at the place and time of sighting were documented, adding context to the observation.
Senior Director of Fordland Air Force Station, Missouri, commented that the object could be a falling star or meteor, suggesting a prosaic explanation for the event.
witnesses: civilian and patrolman from Springfield, Missouri Police Dept., Joplin, Missouri
